contextId.quote: a house for his kingdom
raised their voices
a lofty residence
in the heart of David
shut up the heavens so that there is no rain

contextId.information: AT: "I will remove them from my land." Compares pulling plants up by their roots from the soil, with the removal of God's people of Israel from his land. The results would be destruction of the nation and sadness of the people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: I will uproot them from out of my ground that I have given them

contextId.information: AT: "they have chosen to worship other gods and try to please them." (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: they laid hold of other gods and bowed down to them and worshiped them
which God had put in his heart
do not fight against Yahweh
Yahweh his God was with him

contextId.information: Behaving is spoken of as if it were walking. AT: "lived in the righteous ways of his ancestor" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: walked in the first ways of his father
you will push the Arameans until they are consumed

contextId.information: AT: "to try to get God to pay attention to them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: to seek Yahweh

contextId.information: Jehoshaphat decided that Jehoram should be the king after he died (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: gave the throne

contextId.information: AT: "until this disease causes your death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: until your intestines fall out because of the sickness

contextId.information: AT: "So they began to burn with anger (like a fire)" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: So their anger was greatly kindled
his heart was lifted up
They quickly drove him out of there

contextId.information: AT: "he obeyed Yahweh without straying" or "he lived completely dedicated to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: he walked firmly before Yahweh his God

contextId.information: Here "rest" means "peace." AT: "gave them peace with all the neighboring countries" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] )
contextId.quote: gave them rest on every side

contextId.information: Emotions such as anger are often spoken of in Scripture as if they were liquids. AT: "therefore it will be like a fire that I pour out on them, and nothing will stop this fire" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: therefore my anger will be poured out on this place, and it will not be extinguished
